schema:name: Predicted area of seabed in the UK Continental Shelf exposed to disturbance from bottom contact fishing vessels over 12m long, 2010 to 2015

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:isBasedOn.schema:name: Extent of physical damage to predominant seafloor habitats

schema:author.schema:name: Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the North-East Atlantic

schema:variableMeasured: Predicted area (% of total) exposed to disturbance
notes: The chart shows the percentage area of OSPAR sub-regions in disturbance categories 0 to 4 (no or low disturbance) and 5 to 9 (high disturbance) across the reporting cycle (2010 to 2015). Incomplete data made it difficult to assess disturbance in the Bay of Biscay and Iberian Coast (OSPAR Region IV) and in Arctic Waters (OSPAR Region I).
